It’s important to make sure you understand the eligibility criteria and entry requirements for your chosen degree. Look out for any prerequisites or assumed knowledge subjects, as well as additional entry requirements like interviews or auditions.
For more information, review the entry requirements for your chosen degree.










Learn about English language requirements 








International students seeking admissions to coursework degrees must meet our minimum English language requirements. You can demonstrate your level of English language proficiency by providing the results of an accepted English language test (e.g. IELTS, TOEFL iBT). In some cases, you can also meet minimum language requirements using your previous academic qualifications (e.g. International Baccalaureate) or through practical application of your English skills in a professional environment.
If you don’t meet the minimum English language requirements, you can still apply for a program. If you meet the academic eligibility requirements for admission, we can send you a conditional offer packaged with a Pre-Enrolment English Program (PEP) pathway through our English Language Centre.  
Visit the entry requirements webpage for or more information.



















Apply now
Please ensure you have the following documents ready to upload:
Certified copies of your academic transcripts and graduate certificates (if applicable) for all secondary school and tertiary studies (if these are in a language other than English, certified translations must also be provided)

A copy of your passport. 

Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150 applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University.
You may also need to provide:
Professional qualifications (e.g. short courses) or professional memberships you may have

Official English test results from IELTS, TOEFL iBT, Pearson or Cambridge CAE/CPE or another approved objective test

Syllabus of subjects if you wish to be considered for advanced standing (credit transfer).








Expand all









Applications requiring an Education Agent 








You may be required to apply through an Adelaide University authorised Education Agent. 
We have a wide network of Education Agents around the world that can assist you with the preparation and submission of your application, as well as your student visa application.
Students from the following regions require an Education Agent to apply:
The Middle East

North Africa

Sub-Saharan Africa

South Asia (Bangladesh, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka)

Philippines

Latin America.




Find an Education Agent near you









Changing your Education Agent
If you have lodged an application though an Adelaide University authorised Education Agent but want to change to a different partner, you’ll need to contact us to nominate a new agent.










Applications without an Education Agent 








If you’re applying without an Education Agent, you can lodge your application directly through our Online Application System.




Apply now










Next steps 







Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application. 
The team will carefully review your application and provide an outcome as soon as possible. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment. 
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks. 
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent. 










*Note: Application fees will not be charged for research degrees, 100% online programs, and non-award programs, such as Study Abroad and Exchange or standalone English Language Centre programs.

Find out how to accept your offer and next steps.

*Note: Application fees will not be charged for research degrees, 100% online programs, and non-award programs, such as Study Abroad and Exchange or standalone English Language Centre programs.

All international applications to study an undergraduate or postgraduate coursework degree at Adelaide University are submitted online through our Online Application System. Ready to apply? We’re here to help
You’ve chosen your degree – now it’s time to apply!
Whether you’re preparing your application yourself or applying through one of our authorised Education Agents, we’re here to help at every step. 
All international applications to study an undergraduate or postgraduate coursework degree at Adelaide University are submitted online through our Online Application System. Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150* applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University. 
We’ve put together the information below to help you prepare, submit and track your application status.




Apply now
Before you apply







Expand all









Prepare your documentation 










You’ll need to provide certified copies of your official academic documents as part of your application. This includes academic transcripts and graduation certificates for all secondary school, tertiary studies and professional qualifications (e.g. short courses).
If your official documents are in a language other than English, you will also need to provide certified translations of these documents, in addition to certified copies of the original non-English documents. To find out more about document certification, contact us.












Check the application closing date for your chosen degree 








Before you apply, it’s a good idea to familiarise yourself with the application closing date for your chosen degree. 
Please note some degrees have different application deadlines. We recommend you check the specific deadline for your chosen degree on the program page.



Find my degree 










Review any additional academic entry requirements 








It’s important to make sure you understand the eligibility criteria and entry requirements for your chosen degree. Look out for any prerequisites or assumed knowledge subjects, as well as additional entry requirements like interviews or auditions.
For more information, review the entry requirements for your chosen degree.










Learn about English language requirements 








International students seeking admissions to coursework degrees must meet our minimum English language requirements. You can demonstrate your level of English language proficiency by providing the results of an accepted English language test (e.g. IELTS, TOEFL iBT). In some cases, you can also meet minimum language requirements using your previous academic qualifications (e.g. International Baccalaureate) or through practical application of your English skills in a professional environment.
If you don’t meet the minimum English language requirements, you can still apply for a program. If you meet the academic eligibility requirements for admission, we can send you a conditional offer packaged with a Pre-Enrolment English Program (PEP) pathway through our English Language Centre.  
Visit the entry requirements webpage for or more information.

Please ensure you have the following documents ready to upload:
Certified copies of your academic transcripts and graduate certificates (if applicable) for all secondary school and tertiary studies (if these are in a language other than English, certified translations must also be provided)

A copy of your passport. 

Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150 applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University.
You may also need to provide:
Professional qualifications (e.g. short courses) or professional memberships you may have

Official English test results from IELTS, TOEFL iBT, Pearson or Cambridge CAE/CPE or another approved objective test

Syllabus of subjects if you wish to be considered for advanced standing (credit transfer).








Expand all









Applications requiring an Education Agent 








You may be required to apply through an Adelaide University authorised Education Agent. 
We have a wide network of Education Agents around the world that can assist you with the preparation and submission of your application, as well as your student visa application.
Students from the following regions require an Education Agent to apply:
The Middle East

North Africa

Sub-Saharan Africa

South Asia (Bangladesh, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka)

Philippines

Latin America.




Find an Education Agent near you









Changing your Education Agent
If you have lodged an application though an Adelaide University authorised Education Agent but want to change to a different partner, you’ll need to contact us to nominate a new agent.










Applications without an Education Agent 








If you’re applying without an Education Agent, you can lodge your application directly through our Online Application System.




Apply now










Next steps 







Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application. 
The team will carefully review your application and provide an outcome as soon as possible. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment. 
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks. 
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent. 










*Note: Application fees will not be charged for research degrees, 100% online programs, and non-award programs, such as Study Abroad and Exchange or standalone English Language Centre programs.

Certified copies of your academic transcripts and graduate certificates (if applicable) for all secondary school and tertiary studies (if these are in a language other than English, certified translations must also be provided)

A copy of your passport. 

Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150 applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University.
You may also need to provide:
Professional qualifications (e.g. short courses) or professional memberships you may have

Official English test results from IELTS, TOEFL iBT, Pearson or Cambridge CAE/CPE or another approved objective test

Syllabus of subjects if you wish to be considered for advanced standing (credit transfer).








Expand all









Applications requiring an Education Agent 








You may be required to apply through an Adelaide University authorised Education Agent. 
We have a wide network of Education Agents around the world that can assist you with the preparation and submission of your application, as well as your student visa application.
Students from the following regions require an Education Agent to apply:
The Middle East

North Africa

Sub-Saharan Africa

South Asia (Bangladesh, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka)

Philippines

Latin America.




Find an Education Agent near you









Changing your Education Agent
If you have lodged an application though an Adelaide University authorised Education Agent but want to change to a different partner, you’ll need to contact us to nominate a new agent.










Applications without an Education Agent 








If you’re applying without an Education Agent, you can lodge your application directly through our Online Application System.




Apply now










Next steps 







Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application. 
The team will carefully review your application and provide an outcome as soon as possible. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment. 
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks. 
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent. 










*Note: Application fees will not be charged for research degrees, 100% online programs, and non-award programs, such as Study Abroad and Exchange or standalone English Language Centre programs.

[GRID_TABLE]
Before you apply







Expand all









Prepare your documentation 










You’ll need to provide certified copies of your official academic documents as part of your application. This includes academic transcripts and graduation certificates for all secondary school, tertiary studies and professional qualifications (e.g. short courses).
If your official documents are in a language other than English, you will also need to provide certified translations of these documents, in addition to certified copies of the original non-English documents. To find out more about document certification, contact us.












Check the application closing date for your chosen degree 








Before you apply, it’s a good idea to familiarise yourself with the application closing date for your chosen degree. 
Please note some degrees have different application deadlines. We recommend you check the specific deadline for your chosen degree on the program page.



Find my degree 










Review any additional academic entry requirements 








It’s important to make sure you understand the eligibility criteria and entry requirements for your chosen degree. Look out for any prerequisites or assumed knowledge subjects, as well as additional entry requirements like interviews or auditions.
For more information, review the entry requirements for your chosen degree.










Learn about English language requirements 








International students seeking admissions to coursework degrees must meet our minimum English language requirements. You can demonstrate your level of English language proficiency by providing the results of an accepted English language test (e.g. IELTS, TOEFL iBT). In some cases, you can also meet minimum language requirements using your previous academic qualifications (e.g. International Baccalaureate) or through practical application of your English skills in a professional environment.
If you don’t meet the minimum English language requirements, you can still apply for a program. If you meet the academic eligibility requirements for admission, we can send you a conditional offer packaged with a Pre-Enrolment English Program (PEP) pathway through our English Language Centre.  
Visit the entry requirements webpage for or more information.

It’s important to make sure you understand the eligibility criteria and entry requirements for your chosen degree. Look out for any prerequisites or assumed knowledge subjects, as well as additional entry requirements like interviews or auditions.
For more information, review the entry requirements for your chosen degree.
It’s important to make sure you understand the eligibility criteria and entry requirements for your chosen degree. Look out for any prerequisites or assumed knowledge subjects, as well as additional entry requirements like interviews or auditions.
For more information, review the entry requirements for your chosen degree.
Learn about English language requirements 








International students seeking admissions to coursework degrees must meet our minimum English language requirements. You can demonstrate your level of English language proficiency by providing the results of an accepted English language test (e.g. IELTS, TOEFL iBT). In some cases, you can also meet minimum language requirements using your previous academic qualifications (e.g. International Baccalaureate) or through practical application of your English skills in a professional environment.
If you don’t meet the minimum English language requirements, you can still apply for a program. If you meet the academic eligibility requirements for admission, we can send you a conditional offer packaged with a Pre-Enrolment English Program (PEP) pathway through our English Language Centre.  
Visit the entry requirements webpage for or more information.

Visit the entry requirements webpage for or more information.
[GRID_TABLE]
You’ll need to provide certified copies of your official academic documents as part of your application. This includes academic transcripts and graduation certificates for all secondary school, tertiary studies and professional qualifications (e.g. short courses).
If your official documents are in a language other than English, you will also need to provide certified translations of these documents, in addition to certified copies of the original non-English documents. To find out more about document certification, contact us.

Apply now
Please ensure you have the following documents ready to upload:
Certified copies of your academic transcripts and graduate certificates (if applicable) for all secondary school and tertiary studies (if these are in a language other than English, certified translations must also be provided)

A copy of your passport. 

Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150 applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University.
You may also need to provide:
Professional qualifications (e.g. short courses) or professional memberships you may have

Official English test results from IELTS, TOEFL iBT, Pearson or Cambridge CAE/CPE or another approved objective test

Syllabus of subjects if you wish to be considered for advanced standing (credit transfer).








Expand all









Applications requiring an Education Agent 








You may be required to apply through an Adelaide University authorised Education Agent. 
We have a wide network of Education Agents around the world that can assist you with the preparation and submission of your application, as well as your student visa application.
Students from the following regions require an Education Agent to apply:
The Middle East

North Africa

Sub-Saharan Africa

South Asia (Bangladesh, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka)

Philippines

Latin America.




Find an Education Agent near you









Changing your Education Agent
If you have lodged an application though an Adelaide University authorised Education Agent but want to change to a different partner, you’ll need to contact us to nominate a new agent.










Applications without an Education Agent 








If you’re applying without an Education Agent, you can lodge your application directly through our Online Application System.




Apply now










Next steps 







Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application. 
The team will carefully review your application and provide an outcome as soon as possible. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment. 
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks. 
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent. 










*Note: Application fees will not be charged for research degrees, 100% online programs, and non-award programs, such as Study Abroad and Exchange or standalone English Language Centre programs.

pages.title: Apply now

pages.content:
[HEADING] How to apply – international students
[HEADING] International student applications to Adelaide University
[HEADING] Research degree students
[HEADING] Before you begin
[HEADING] Our three-step application guide
[HEADING] Step 1 – Determine your application process
[HEADING] Applying through an Education Agent
[HEADING] Applying directly
[HEADING] Step 2 – Assessment of your application
[HEADING] Step 3 – Accept your offer
If you’re an international student, applications to study with us are open now. Whatever your starting point, we’re here to guide you through our application process.
If you’re interested in studying a research degree, applications are open now. Follow our step-by-step guide and apply.
Find the degree you want to apply for and make sure you meet the following:
Academic entry requirements
English language requirements
Genuine Student requirement
Financial capacity requirement.
For more information about these requirements, visit the international entry requirements webpage.
Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150* applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University.
If you’re not eligible for direct entry, you may be eligible to study with one of our pathway providers and receive a packaged offer to gain entry to Adelaide University.
You can apply through one of Adelaide University’s Education Agents or directly via our Online Application System.
You may be required to apply through an Education Agent. Adelaide University has a wide network of Education Agents around the world that can assist you with the preparation and submission of your application, as well as your student visa application.
Students from the following regions require an Education Agent to apply:
The Middle East
North Africa
Sub-Saharan Africa
South Asia (Bangladesh, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka)
Philippines
Latin America.
If you’re applying without an Education Agent you can lodge your application directly through our Online Application System.
Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment.
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks.
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent.
Successful applicants will receive the following:
Offer of Admission
Acceptance Form
Terms and Conditions of Acceptance
Payment and Refund Terms and Conditions
Study Plan (if credit or advanced standing has been awarded).
To accept your offer, you’ll need to complete the following steps:
Read and agree to all Terms and Conditions.
Complete and sign your Acceptance Form.
Arrange payment of your Acceptance fee as per the instructions in your Offer of Admission. Payment must be made via our Online Application System.
Arrange for payment of your Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for the duration of your Student Visa. This can be paid to the University who will arrange this on your behalf, or you can organise OSHC yourself.
Arrange for payment of English language program fees (if applicable).
Provide a copy of the Personal Details and signature section of your passport.
If you are sponsored, you'll need to include a financial guarantee letter from your sponsor, or scholarship provider, that states the costs covered and the name of the program as part of your offer acceptance in our Online Application System.
*Note: Application fees will not be charged for research degrees, 100% online programs, and non-award programs, such as Study Abroad and Exchange or standalone English Language Centre programs.

• English language requirements

• Financial capacity requirement.

• Complete and sign your Acceptance Form.
• Arrange payment of your Acceptance fee as per the instructions in your Offer of Admission. Payment must be made via our Online Application System.
• Arrange for payment of your Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for the duration of your Student Visa. This can be paid to the University who will arrange this on your behalf, or you can organise OSHC yourself.
• Arrange for payment of English language program fees (if applicable).
• Provide a copy of the Personal Details and signature section of your passport.
[GRID_TABLE]
How to apply – international students
    




Apply now
View entry requirements




















Show menu









International student applications to Adelaide University 
If you’re an international student, applications to study with us are open now. Whatever your starting point, we’re here to guide you through our application process. 













        Research degree students
    
If you’re interested in studying a research degree, applications are open now. Follow our step-by-step guide and apply. 



        Apply as a research degree student















Before you begin  
Find the degree you want to apply for and make sure you meet the following:  
Academic entry requirements  

English language requirements  

Genuine Student requirement   

Financial capacity requirement.   

For more information about these requirements, visit the international entry requirements webpage.   

Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150* applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University.
If you’re not eligible for direct entry, you may be eligible to study with one of our pathway providers and receive a packaged offer to gain entry to Adelaide University.







Our three-step application guide













        Step 1 – Determine your application process 
    
You can apply through one of Adelaide University’s Education Agents or directly via our Online Application System.















        Applying through an Education Agent  
    
You may be required to apply through an Education Agent. Adelaide University has a wide network of Education Agents around the world that can assist you with the preparation and submission of your application, as well as your student visa application.   
Students from the following regions require an Education Agent to apply:
The Middle East

North Africa

Sub-Saharan Africa

South Asia (Bangladesh, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka)

Philippines

Latin America.




        Find an Education Agent near you  










        Applying directly 
    
If you’re applying without an Education Agent you can lodge your application directly through our Online Application System. 



        Online Application System


























        Step 2 – Assessment of your application 
    
Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment. 
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks. 
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent.
 Successful applicants will receive the following:  
Offer of Admission  

Acceptance Form  

Terms and Conditions of Acceptance 

Payment and Refund Terms and Conditions   

Study Plan (if credit or advanced standing has been awarded).  






















        Step 3 – Accept your offer  
    
To accept your offer, you’ll need to complete the following steps:  
Read and agree to all Terms and Conditions.  

Complete and sign your Acceptance Form.   

Arrange payment of your Acceptance fee as per the instructions in your Offer of Admission. Payment must be made via our Online Application System. 

Arrange for payment of your Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for the duration of your Student Visa. This can be paid to the University who will arrange this on your behalf, or you can organise OSHC yourself.   

Arrange for payment of English language program fees (if applicable).   

Provide a copy of the Personal Details and signature section of your passport.   

If you are sponsored, you'll need to include a financial guarantee letter from your sponsor, or scholarship provider, that states the costs covered and the name of the program as part of your offer acceptance in our Online Application System. 











More information on accepting your offer



















*Note: Application fees will not be charged for research degrees, 100% online programs, and non-award programs, such as Study Abroad and Exchange or standalone English Language Centre programs.

For more information about these requirements, visit the international entry requirements webpage.   

Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150* applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University.
If you’re not eligible for direct entry, you may be eligible to study with one of our pathway providers and receive a packaged offer to gain entry to Adelaide University.







Our three-step application guide













        Step 1 – Determine your application process 
    
You can apply through one of Adelaide University’s Education Agents or directly via our Online Application System.















        Applying through an Education Agent  
    
You may be required to apply through an Education Agent. Adelaide University has a wide network of Education Agents around the world that can assist you with the preparation and submission of your application, as well as your student visa application.   
Students from the following regions require an Education Agent to apply:
The Middle East

North Africa

Sub-Saharan Africa

South Asia (Bangladesh, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka)

Philippines

Latin America.




        Find an Education Agent near you  










        Applying directly 
    
If you’re applying without an Education Agent you can lodge your application directly through our Online Application System. 



        Online Application System


























        Step 2 – Assessment of your application 
    
Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment. 
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks. 
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent.
 Successful applicants will receive the following:  
Offer of Admission  

Acceptance Form  

Terms and Conditions of Acceptance 

Payment and Refund Terms and Conditions   

Study Plan (if credit or advanced standing has been awarded).  






















        Step 3 – Accept your offer  
    
To accept your offer, you’ll need to complete the following steps:  
Read and agree to all Terms and Conditions.  

Complete and sign your Acceptance Form.   

Arrange payment of your Acceptance fee as per the instructions in your Offer of Admission. Payment must be made via our Online Application System. 

Arrange for payment of your Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for the duration of your Student Visa. This can be paid to the University who will arrange this on your behalf, or you can organise OSHC yourself.   

Arrange for payment of English language program fees (if applicable).   

Provide a copy of the Personal Details and signature section of your passport.   

If you are sponsored, you'll need to include a financial guarantee letter from your sponsor, or scholarship provider, that states the costs covered and the name of the program as part of your offer acceptance in our Online Application System. 











More information on accepting your offer



















*Note: Application fees will not be charged for research degrees, 100% online programs, and non-award programs, such as Study Abroad and Exchange or standalone English Language Centre programs.

Before you begin

Academic entry requirements  

English language requirements  

Genuine Student requirement   

Financial capacity requirement.   

For more information about these requirements, visit the international entry requirements webpage.   

Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150* applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University.
If you’re not eligible for direct entry, you may be eligible to study with one of our pathway providers and receive a packaged offer to gain entry to Adelaide University.







Our three-step application guide













        Step 1 – Determine your application process 
    
You can apply through one of Adelaide University’s Education Agents or directly via our Online Application System.















        Applying through an Education Agent  
    
You may be required to apply through an Education Agent. Adelaide University has a wide network of Education Agents around the world that can assist you with the preparation and submission of your application, as well as your student visa application.

If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks. 
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent.

Arrange for payment of your Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for the duration of your Student Visa. This can be paid to the University who will arrange this on your behalf, or you can organise OSHC yourself.   

Arrange for payment of English language program fees (if applicable).   

Provide a copy of the Personal Details and signature section of your passport.   

If you are sponsored, you'll need to include a financial guarantee letter from your sponsor, or scholarship provider, that states the costs covered and the name of the program as part of your offer acceptance in our Online Application System. 











More information on accepting your offer

Terms and Conditions of Acceptance 

Payment and Refund Terms and Conditions

        Step 3 – Accept your offer  
    
To accept your offer, you’ll need to complete the following steps:  
Read and agree to all Terms and Conditions.  

Complete and sign your Acceptance Form.   

Arrange payment of your Acceptance fee as per the instructions in your Offer of Admission. Payment must be made via our Online Application System. 

Arrange for payment of your Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for the duration of your Student Visa. This can be paid to the University who will arrange this on your behalf, or you can organise OSHC yourself.   

Arrange for payment of English language program fees (if applicable).   

Provide a copy of the Personal Details and signature section of your passport.   

If you are sponsored, you'll need to include a financial guarantee letter from your sponsor, or scholarship provider, that states the costs covered and the name of the program as part of your offer acceptance in our Online Application System.

You may be required to apply through an Education Agent. Adelaide University has a wide network of Education Agents around the world that can assist you with the preparation and submission of your application, as well as your student visa application.   
Students from the following regions require an Education Agent to apply:
The Middle East

North Africa

Sub-Saharan Africa

South Asia (Bangladesh, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka)

Philippines

Latin America.




        Find an Education Agent near you  










        Applying directly 
    
If you’re applying without an Education Agent you can lodge your application directly through our Online Application System. 



        Online Application System


























        Step 2 – Assessment of your application 
    
Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment. 
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks. 
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent.
 Successful applicants will receive the following:  
Offer of Admission  

Acceptance Form  

Terms and Conditions of Acceptance 

Payment and Refund Terms and Conditions   

Study Plan (if credit or advanced standing has been awarded).  






















        Step 3 – Accept your offer  
    
To accept your offer, you’ll need to complete the following steps:  
Read and agree to all Terms and Conditions.  

Complete and sign your Acceptance Form.   

Arrange payment of your Acceptance fee as per the instructions in your Offer of Admission. Payment must be made via our Online Application System. 

Arrange for payment of your Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for the duration of your Student Visa. This can be paid to the University who will arrange this on your behalf, or you can organise OSHC yourself.   

Arrange for payment of English language program fees (if applicable).   

Provide a copy of the Personal Details and signature section of your passport.   

If you are sponsored, you'll need to include a financial guarantee letter from your sponsor, or scholarship provider, that states the costs covered and the name of the program as part of your offer acceptance in our Online Application System. 











More information on accepting your offer



















*Note: Application fees will not be charged for research degrees, 100% online programs, and non-award programs, such as Study Abroad and Exchange or standalone English Language Centre programs.

Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment. 
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks. 
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent.
 Successful applicants will receive the following:  
Offer of Admission  

Acceptance Form  

Terms and Conditions of Acceptance 

Payment and Refund Terms and Conditions   

Study Plan (if credit or advanced standing has been awarded).

Step 3 – Accept your offer  
    
To accept your offer, you’ll need to complete the following steps:  
Read and agree to all Terms and Conditions.  

Complete and sign your Acceptance Form.   

Arrange payment of your Acceptance fee as per the instructions in your Offer of Admission. Payment must be made via our Online Application System. 

Arrange for payment of your Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for the duration of your Student Visa. This can be paid to the University who will arrange this on your behalf, or you can organise OSHC yourself.   

Arrange for payment of English language program fees (if applicable).   

Provide a copy of the Personal Details and signature section of your passport.   

If you are sponsored, you'll need to include a financial guarantee letter from your sponsor, or scholarship provider, that states the costs covered and the name of the program as part of your offer acceptance in our Online Application System.

International student applications to Adelaide University 
If you’re an international student, applications to study with us are open now. Whatever your starting point, we’re here to guide you through our application process. 













        Research degree students
    
If you’re interested in studying a research degree, applications are open now. Follow our step-by-step guide and apply. 



        Apply as a research degree student















Before you begin  
Find the degree you want to apply for and make sure you meet the following:  
Academic entry requirements  

English language requirements  

Genuine Student requirement   

Financial capacity requirement.   

For more information about these requirements, visit the international entry requirements webpage.   

Please note that a non-refundable application fee of AUD$150* applies for every application submitted to Adelaide University.
If you’re not eligible for direct entry, you may be eligible to study with one of our pathway providers and receive a packaged offer to gain entry to Adelaide University.







Our three-step application guide













        Step 1 – Determine your application process 
    
You can apply through one of Adelaide University’s Education Agents or directly via our Online Application System.















        Applying through an Education Agent  
    
You may be required to apply through an Education Agent. Adelaide University has a wide network of Education Agents around the world that can assist you with the preparation and submission of your application, as well as your student visa application.   
Students from the following regions require an Education Agent to apply:
The Middle East

North Africa

Sub-Saharan Africa

South Asia (Bangladesh, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka)

Philippines

Latin America.




        Find an Education Agent near you  










        Applying directly 
    
If you’re applying without an Education Agent you can lodge your application directly through our Online Application System. 



        Online Application System


























        Step 2 – Assessment of your application 
    
Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment. 
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks. 
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent.
 Successful applicants will receive the following:  
Offer of Admission  

Acceptance Form  

Terms and Conditions of Acceptance 

Payment and Refund Terms and Conditions   

Study Plan (if credit or advanced standing has been awarded).  






















        Step 3 – Accept your offer  
    
To accept your offer, you’ll need to complete the following steps:  
Read and agree to all Terms and Conditions.  

Complete and sign your Acceptance Form.   

Arrange payment of your Acceptance fee as per the instructions in your Offer of Admission. Payment must be made via our Online Application System. 

Arrange for payment of your Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for the duration of your Student Visa. This can be paid to the University who will arrange this on your behalf, or you can organise OSHC yourself.   

Arrange for payment of English language program fees (if applicable).   

Provide a copy of the Personal Details and signature section of your passport.   

If you are sponsored, you'll need to include a financial guarantee letter from your sponsor, or scholarship provider, that states the costs covered and the name of the program as part of your offer acceptance in our Online Application System. 











More information on accepting your offer



















*Note: Application fees will not be charged for research degrees, 100% online programs, and non-award programs, such as Study Abroad and Exchange or standalone English Language Centre programs.

Offer of Admission  

Acceptance Form  

Terms and Conditions of Acceptance 

Payment and Refund Terms and Conditions   

Study Plan (if credit or advanced standing has been awarded).
Step 2 – Assessment of your application 
    
Once you've submitted all required documents and paid your application fee, our International Admissions team will begin assessing your application. Right now, we're experiencing a high volume of applications, so it may take up to six weeks for us to complete the assessment. 
If your application requires a credit assessment, the process may take a little longer - up to eight weeks. 
Once your application has been assessed, Adelaide University will contact you or your Education Agent with an outcome. If you are successful, you'll receive your offer directly by email or via your Education Agent.
 Successful applicants will receive the following:  
Offer of Admission  

Acceptance Form  

Terms and Conditions of Acceptance 

Payment and Refund Terms and Conditions   

Study Plan (if credit or advanced standing has been awarded).
Step 3 – Accept your offer  
    
To accept your offer, you’ll need to complete the following steps:  
Read and agree to all Terms and Conditions.  

Complete and sign your Acceptance Form.   

Arrange payment of your Acceptance fee as per the instructions in your Offer of Admission. Payment must be made via our Online Application System. 

Arrange for payment of your Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for the duration of your Student Visa. This can be paid to the University who will arrange this on your behalf, or you can organise OSHC yourself.   

Arrange for payment of English language program fees (if applicable).   

Provide a copy of the Personal Details and signature section of your passport.   

If you are sponsored, you'll need to include a financial guarantee letter from your sponsor, or scholarship provider, that states the costs covered and the name of the program as part of your offer acceptance in our Online Application System.

Step 3 – Accept your offer  
    
To accept your offer, you’ll need to complete the following steps:  
Read and agree to all Terms and Conditions.  

Complete and sign your Acceptance Form.   

Arrange payment of your Acceptance fee as per the instructions in your Offer of Admission. Payment must be made via our Online Application System. 

Arrange for payment of your Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for the duration of your Student Visa. This can be paid to the University who will arrange this on your behalf, or you can organise OSHC yourself.   

Arrange for payment of English language program fees (if applicable).   

Provide a copy of the Personal Details and signature section of your passport.   

If you are sponsored, you'll need to include a financial guarantee letter from your sponsor, or scholarship provider, that states the costs covered and the name of the program as part of your offer acceptance in our Online Application System.

Read and agree to all Terms and Conditions.  

Complete and sign your Acceptance Form.   

Arrange payment of your Acceptance fee as per the instructions in your Offer of Admission. Payment must be made via our Online Application System. 

Arrange for payment of your Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for the duration of your Student Visa. This can be paid to the University who will arrange this on your behalf, or you can organise OSHC yourself.   

Arrange for payment of English language program fees (if applicable).   

Provide a copy of the Personal Details and signature section of your passport.   

If you are sponsored, you'll need to include a financial guarantee letter from your sponsor, or scholarship provider, that states the costs covered and the name of the program as part of your offer acceptance in our Online Application System.

pages.content:
[HEADING] International entry requirements
[HEADING] Entry requirements for international students
[HEADING] Academic entry requirements
[HEADING] Undergraduate degree programs
[HEADING] Recent secondary education
[HEADING] Higher education study
[HEADING] Vocational Education and Training (VET)
[HEADING] Postgraduate degree programs
[HEADING] English language proficiency
[HEADING] More information
[HEADING] Genuine Student (GS) requirement
[HEADING] Financial capacity requirement
The following information provides a general overview of the international entry requirements, English language requirements, Genuine Student requirements and financial capacity requirements that must be satisfied for entry into one of our undergraduate or postgraduate degrees.
Please note these provide a general guide only and should be read in conjunction with the specific entry requirement information for your chosen degree.
In alignment with the Admissions Policy and Procedure, applicants are required to meet one of the following criteria with a competitive result and demonstrate that they fulfil any prerequisite requirements and essential requirements for admission:
Completion of a secondary education qualification equivalent to SACE, such as an interstate year 12 or international qualification.
Successful completion of at least six months full-time study (or equivalent part-time) of a bachelor program (Australian Qualifications Framework (AQF) level 7), or higher, at a recognised higher education institution.
Overseas qualifications considered by Adelaide University as equivalent to the above Australian qualifications may be accepted however English language requirements will also apply.
Completion of an award from a registered training organisation (RTO) at Certificate IV (Australian Qualifications Framework (AQF) level 4), or higher.
And the following essential program requirements for Admission:
Postgraduate applicants are required to have one of the following:
To be admitted to a coursework program at Adelaide University, International students from non-English speaking backgrounds must meet our minimum English language requirements. The minimum English language requirement for entry to an Adelaide University undergraduate program is an International English Language Testing System (IELTS) Academic overall score of 6.0 or equivalent. However, English language entry requirements are degree specific, and some degrees have higher English language requirements. This means the exact requirement will depend upon the degree you are applying to. Please visit the degree page for more information.
You can demonstrate your level of English language proficiency by providing the results of an accepted English language test (e.g. IELTS, PTE), taken within the last two years prior to admission. In some cases, you can also meet minimum language requirements using your previous academic qualifications (e.g. a Diploma completed in Australia) or through practical application of your English skills in a professional environment. Where previous study/work experience was conducted in English, the application must be accompanied by certified documentation from the educational institution/employer certifying that the language of instruction/employment was English.
If you don’t meet the minimum English language requirements, you can still apply for a program and if you meet the academic eligibility requirements for admission, we can send you a conditional offer packaged with an English language preparatory program from our English Language Centre.
Proof of English language proficiency, in addition to the academic entry requirements, does not guarantee a place at Adelaide University. Applications are considered on an individual basis and selection is competitive.
For a comprehensive list of all English language tests accepted by Adelaide University, please visit the English language proficiency page.
The Genuine Student (GS) requirement is an Australian Government integrity measure that applies to all student visa applicants. It considers whether the individual circumstances of a student indicate that their intention is to stay in Australia specifically for study.
All applicants for a student visa must be a genuine applicant for entry. They must stay as a student and be able to show an understanding that studying in Australia is the primary reason of their student visa. The GS requirement is intended to include students who, after studying in Australia, develop skills Australia needs and who then go on to apply for permanent residence.
Your offer may include a condition requiring satisfaction of Adelaide University’s Genuine Student requirement. We will undertake further checks of your application and you may be asked to book and complete an interview as part of this process.
Adelaide University must also be satisfied that you are able to financially support yourself and your accompanying family (if you have dependants) while you are studying. This means that you must be able to meet the cost of tuition fees and your living expenses, and that you understand that you will not be able to ask the University to waive your tuition fees, or pay any of your costs while you are living in Australia.
View non-tuition fees
• Prerequisites
• Assumed knowledge.
• A completed bachelor degree from a recognised higher education institution or equivalent; or
• A completed graduate diploma from a recognised higher education institution; or
• A completed graduate certificate from a recognised higher education institution.

International entry requirements
    




















Show menu












Entry requirements for international students
The following information provides a general overview of the international entry requirements, English language requirements, Genuine Student requirements and financial capacity requirements that must be satisfied for entry into one of our undergraduate or postgraduate degrees. 
Please note these provide a general guide only and should be read in conjunction with the specific entry requirement information for your chosen degree.




Find your degree












Expand all









Academic entry requirements 








Undergraduate degree programs

In alignment with the Admissions Policy and Procedure, applicants are required to meet one of the following criteria with a competitive result and demonstrate that they fulfil any prerequisite requirements and essential requirements for admission: 
Recent secondary education 
Completion of a secondary education qualification equivalent to SACE, such as an interstate year 12 or international qualification. 
Higher education study 
Successful completion of at least six months full-time study (or equivalent part-time) of a bachelor program (Australian Qualifications Framework (AQF) level 7), or higher, at a recognised higher education institution. 
Overseas qualifications considered by Adelaide University as equivalent to the above Australian qualifications may be accepted however English language requirements will also apply. 
Vocational Education and Training (VET) 
Completion of an award from a registered training organisation (RTO) at Certificate IV (Australian Qualifications Framework (AQF) level 4), or higher. 
And the following essential program requirements for Admission: 

Prerequisites  Assumed knowledge. 









Postgraduate degree programs

Postgraduate applicants are required to have one of the following: 
A completed bachelor degree from a recognised higher education institution or equivalent; orA completed graduate diploma from a recognised higher education institution; orA completed graduate certificate from a recognised higher education institution. 
Overseas qualifications considered by Adelaide University as equivalent to the above Australian qualifications may be accepted however English language requirements will also apply.










English language proficiency








To be admitted to a coursework program at Adelaide University, International students from non-English speaking backgrounds must meet our minimum English language requirements. The minimum English language requirement for entry to an Adelaide University undergraduate program is an International English Language Testing System (IELTS) Academic overall score of 6.0 or equivalent. However, English language entry requirements are degree specific, and some degrees have higher English language requirements. This means the exact requirement will depend upon the degree you are applying to. Please visit the degree page for more information. 
You can demonstrate your level of English language proficiency by providing the results of an accepted English language test (e.g. IELTS, PTE), taken within the last two years prior to admission. In some cases, you can also meet minimum language requirements using your previous academic qualifications (e.g. a Diploma completed in Australia) or through practical application of your English skills in a professional environment. Where previous study/work experience was conducted in English, the application must be accompanied by certified documentation from the educational institution/employer certifying that the language of instruction/employment was English.  
If you don’t meet the minimum English language requirements, you can still apply for a program and if you meet the academic eligibility requirements for admission, we can send you a conditional offer packaged with an English language preparatory program from our English Language Centre.
Proof of English language proficiency, in addition to the academic entry requirements, does not guarantee a place at Adelaide University. Applications are considered on an individual basis and selection is competitive.
More information   
For a comprehensive list of all English language tests accepted by Adelaide University, please visit the English language proficiency page.   
 










Genuine Student (GS) requirement 








The Genuine Student (GS) requirement is an Australian Government integrity measure that applies to all student visa applicants. It considers whether the individual circumstances of a student indicate that their intention is to stay in Australia specifically for study. 
All applicants for a student visa must be a genuine applicant for entry. They must stay as a student and be able to show an understanding that studying in Australia is the primary reason of their student visa. The GS requirement is intended to include students who, after studying in Australia, develop skills Australia needs and who then go on to apply for permanent residence. 
Your offer may include a condition requiring satisfaction of Adelaide University’s Genuine Student requirement. We will undertake further checks of your application and you may be asked to book and complete an interview as part of this process.  




Find out more










Financial capacity requirement








Adelaide University must also be satisfied that you are able to financially support yourself and your accompanying family (if you have dependants) while you are studying. This means that you must be able to meet the cost of tuition fees and your living expenses, and that you understand that you will not be able to ask the University to waive your tuition fees, or pay any of your costs while you are living in Australia.

To be admitted to a coursework program at Adelaide University, International students from non-English speaking backgrounds must meet our minimum English language requirements. The minimum English language requirement for entry to an Adelaide University undergraduate program is an International English Language Testing System (IELTS) Academic overall score of 6.0 or equivalent. However, English language entry requirements are degree specific, and some degrees have higher English language requirements. This means the exact requirement will depend upon the degree you are applying to. Please visit the degree page for more information. 
You can demonstrate your level of English language proficiency by providing the results of an accepted English language test (e.g. IELTS, PTE), taken within the last two years prior to admission. In some cases, you can also meet minimum language requirements using your previous academic qualifications (e.g. a Diploma completed in Australia) or through practical application of your English skills in a professional environment. Where previous study/work experience was conducted in English, the application must be accompanied by certified documentation from the educational institution/employer certifying that the language of instruction/employment was English.  
If you don’t meet the minimum English language requirements, you can still apply for a program and if you meet the academic eligibility requirements for admission, we can send you a conditional offer packaged with an English language preparatory program from our English Language Centre.
Proof of English language proficiency, in addition to the academic entry requirements, does not guarantee a place at Adelaide University. Applications are considered on an individual basis and selection is competitive.
More information   
For a comprehensive list of all English language tests accepted by Adelaide University, please visit the English language proficiency page.   
 










Genuine Student (GS) requirement 








The Genuine Student (GS) requirement is an Australian Government integrity measure that applies to all student visa applicants. It considers whether the individual circumstances of a student indicate that their intention is to stay in Australia specifically for study. 
All applicants for a student visa must be a genuine applicant for entry. They must stay as a student and be able to show an understanding that studying in Australia is the primary reason of their student visa. The GS requirement is intended to include students who, after studying in Australia, develop skills Australia needs and who then go on to apply for permanent residence. 
Your offer may include a condition requiring satisfaction of Adelaide University’s Genuine Student requirement. We will undertake further checks of your application and you may be asked to book and complete an interview as part of this process.  




Find out more










Financial capacity requirement








Adelaide University must also be satisfied that you are able to financially support yourself and your accompanying family (if you have dependants) while you are studying. This means that you must be able to meet the cost of tuition fees and your living expenses, and that you understand that you will not be able to ask the University to waive your tuition fees, or pay any of your costs while you are living in Australia.
View non-tuition fees

Entry requirements for international students
The following information provides a general overview of the international entry requirements, English language requirements, Genuine Student requirements and financial capacity requirements that must be satisfied for entry into one of our undergraduate or postgraduate degrees. 
Please note these provide a general guide only and should be read in conjunction with the specific entry requirement information for your chosen degree.




Find your degree












Expand all









Academic entry requirements 








Undergraduate degree programs

In alignment with the Admissions Policy and Procedure, applicants are required to meet one of the following criteria with a competitive result and demonstrate that they fulfil any prerequisite requirements and essential requirements for admission: 
Recent secondary education 
Completion of a secondary education qualification equivalent to SACE, such as an interstate year 12 or international qualification. 
Higher education study 
Successful completion of at least six months full-time study (or equivalent part-time) of a bachelor program (Australian Qualifications Framework (AQF) level 7), or higher, at a recognised higher education institution. 
Overseas qualifications considered by Adelaide University as equivalent to the above Australian qualifications may be accepted however English language requirements will also apply. 
Vocational Education and Training (VET) 
Completion of an award from a registered training organisation (RTO) at Certificate IV (Australian Qualifications Framework (AQF) level 4), or higher. 
And the following essential program requirements for Admission: 

Prerequisites  Assumed knowledge. 









Postgraduate degree programs

Postgraduate applicants are required to have one of the following: 
A completed bachelor degree from a recognised higher education institution or equivalent; orA completed graduate diploma from a recognised higher education institution; orA completed graduate certificate from a recognised higher education institution. 
Overseas qualifications considered by Adelaide University as equivalent to the above Australian qualifications may be accepted however English language requirements will also apply.










English language proficiency








To be admitted to a coursework program at Adelaide University, International students from non-English speaking backgrounds must meet our minimum English language requirements. The minimum English language requirement for entry to an Adelaide University undergraduate program is an International English Language Testing System (IELTS) Academic overall score of 6.0 or equivalent. However, English language entry requirements are degree specific, and some degrees have higher English language requirements. This means the exact requirement will depend upon the degree you are applying to. Please visit the degree page for more information. 
You can demonstrate your level of English language proficiency by providing the results of an accepted English language test (e.g. IELTS, PTE), taken within the last two years prior to admission. In some cases, you can also meet minimum language requirements using your previous academic qualifications (e.g. a Diploma completed in Australia) or through practical application of your English skills in a professional environment. Where previous study/work experience was conducted in English, the application must be accompanied by certified documentation from the educational institution/employer certifying that the language of instruction/employment was English.  
If you don’t meet the minimum English language requirements, you can still apply for a program and if you meet the academic eligibility requirements for admission, we can send you a conditional offer packaged with an English language preparatory program from our English Language Centre.
Proof of English language proficiency, in addition to the academic entry requirements, does not guarantee a place at Adelaide University. Applications are considered on an individual basis and selection is competitive.
More information   
For a comprehensive list of all English language tests accepted by Adelaide University, please visit the English language proficiency page.   
 










Genuine Student (GS) requirement 








The Genuine Student (GS) requirement is an Australian Government integrity measure that applies to all student visa applicants. It considers whether the individual circumstances of a student indicate that their intention is to stay in Australia specifically for study. 
All applicants for a student visa must be a genuine applicant for entry. They must stay as a student and be able to show an understanding that studying in Australia is the primary reason of their student visa. The GS requirement is intended to include students who, after studying in Australia, develop skills Australia needs and who then go on to apply for permanent residence. 
Your offer may include a condition requiring satisfaction of Adelaide University’s Genuine Student requirement. We will undertake further checks of your application and you may be asked to book and complete an interview as part of this process.  




Find out more










Financial capacity requirement








Adelaide University must also be satisfied that you are able to financially support yourself and your accompanying family (if you have dependants) while you are studying. This means that you must be able to meet the cost of tuition fees and your living expenses, and that you understand that you will not be able to ask the University to waive your tuition fees, or pay any of your costs while you are living in Australia.

Entry requirements for international students
The following information provides a general overview of the international entry requirements, English language requirements, Genuine Student requirements and financial capacity requirements that must be satisfied for entry into one of our undergraduate or postgraduate degrees. 
Please note these provide a general guide only and should be read in conjunction with the specific entry requirement information for your chosen degree.




Find your degree












Expand all









Academic entry requirements 








Undergraduate degree programs

In alignment with the Admissions Policy and Procedure, applicants are required to meet one of the following criteria with a competitive result and demonstrate that they fulfil any prerequisite requirements and essential requirements for admission: 
Recent secondary education 
Completion of a secondary education qualification equivalent to SACE, such as an interstate year 12 or international qualification. 
Higher education study 
Successful completion of at least six months full-time study (or equivalent part-time) of a bachelor program (Australian Qualifications Framework (AQF) level 7), or higher, at a recognised higher education institution. 
Overseas qualifications considered by Adelaide University as equivalent to the above Australian qualifications may be accepted however English language requirements will also apply. 
Vocational Education and Training (VET) 
Completion of an award from a registered training organisation (RTO) at Certificate IV (Australian Qualifications Framework (AQF) level 4), or higher. 
And the following essential program requirements for Admission: 

Prerequisites  Assumed knowledge. 









Postgraduate degree programs

Postgraduate applicants are required to have one of the following: 
A completed bachelor degree from a recognised higher education institution or equivalent; orA completed graduate diploma from a recognised higher education institution; orA completed graduate certificate from a recognised higher education institution. 
Overseas qualifications considered by Adelaide University as equivalent to the above Australian qualifications may be accepted however English language requirements will also apply.










English language proficiency








To be admitted to a coursework program at Adelaide University, International students from non-English speaking backgrounds must meet our minimum English language requirements. The minimum English language requirement for entry to an Adelaide University undergraduate program is an International English Language Testing System (IELTS) Academic overall score of 6.0 or equivalent. However, English language entry requirements are degree specific, and some degrees have higher English language requirements. This means the exact requirement will depend upon the degree you are applying to. Please visit the degree page for more information. 
You can demonstrate your level of English language proficiency by providing the results of an accepted English language test (e.g. IELTS, PTE), taken within the last two years prior to admission. In some cases, you can also meet minimum language requirements using your previous academic qualifications (e.g. a Diploma completed in Australia) or through practical application of your English skills in a professional environment. Where previous study/work experience was conducted in English, the application must be accompanied by certified documentation from the educational institution/employer certifying that the language of instruction/employment was English.  
If you don’t meet the minimum English language requirements, you can still apply for a program and if you meet the academic eligibility requirements for admission, we can send you a conditional offer packaged with an English language preparatory program from our English Language Centre.
Proof of English language proficiency, in addition to the academic entry requirements, does not guarantee a place at Adelaide University. Applications are considered on an individual basis and selection is competitive.
More information   
For a comprehensive list of all English language tests accepted by Adelaide University, please visit the English language proficiency page.   
 










Genuine Student (GS) requirement 








The Genuine Student (GS) requirement is an Australian Government integrity measure that applies to all student visa applicants. It considers whether the individual circumstances of a student indicate that their intention is to stay in Australia specifically for study. 
All applicants for a student visa must be a genuine applicant for entry. They must stay as a student and be able to show an understanding that studying in Australia is the primary reason of their student visa. The GS requirement is intended to include students who, after studying in Australia, develop skills Australia needs and who then go on to apply for permanent residence. 
Your offer may include a condition requiring satisfaction of Adelaide University’s Genuine Student requirement. We will undertake further checks of your application and you may be asked to book and complete an interview as part of this process.  




Find out more










Financial capacity requirement








Adelaide University must also be satisfied that you are able to financially support yourself and your accompanying family (if you have dependants) while you are studying. This means that you must be able to meet the cost of tuition fees and your living expenses, and that you understand that you will not be able to ask the University to waive your tuition fees, or pay any of your costs while you are living in Australia.

Genuine Student (GS) requirement 








The Genuine Student (GS) requirement is an Australian Government integrity measure that applies to all student visa applicants. It considers whether the individual circumstances of a student indicate that their intention is to stay in Australia specifically for study. 
All applicants for a student visa must be a genuine applicant for entry. They must stay as a student and be able to show an understanding that studying in Australia is the primary reason of their student visa. The GS requirement is intended to include students who, after studying in Australia, develop skills Australia needs and who then go on to apply for permanent residence. 
Your offer may include a condition requiring satisfaction of Adelaide University’s Genuine Student requirement. We will undertake further checks of your application and you may be asked to book and complete an interview as part of this process.
